synopsis.p: Search in the sections content for entries specified in a tabular text file.

description.p: reads a list of entries from and searches for each entry key in sections contents. The format of the dictionary is one entry per line. Each line is split into columns separated by tab characters. The column specified by will be the entry key to be searched and the other columns are data associated to the entry.
The parameters , , , , , control how the dictionary file is read by .
The parameters , , , , , , , and control how the keys can match the sections content.

creates an annotation for each matched key and adds these annotations to the layer specified by . The created annotations will have features that correspond to the entry columns. Feature keys are specified by . For instance if valueFeatures is [a,b,c], then each annotation will have three features named a, b and c with the respective values of the entry's first, second and third columns. A feature name left blank in valueFeatures will not create a feature. Thus, in order to drop the first column of the entry, should be [,b,c]. In addition, the created annotations will have the constant features specified in .
If is specified, then assumes that the file contains a compiled version of the dictionary. In this case is not read.
If is specified, writes a compiled version of the dictionary in the file. The use of compiled dictionaries may accelerate the processing for large dictionaries.

param-doc.name: strictColumnNumber
param-doc.p: If set to true, then check that every line in has the same number of columns as the number of features specified in valueFeatures.

param-doc.name: skipBlank
param-doc.p: In , skip lines that contain only whitespace characters.

param-doc.name: trimColumns
param-doc.p: If set to true, then trim leading and trailing whitespace character from column values in .

param-doc.name: separator
param-doc.p: Specifies the character that separates columns in .

param-doc.name: valueFeatures
param-doc.p: Target features in match annotations. The values are the columns in the entry. Ignored if headerLine is set (unless trieSource is set).

param-doc.name: headerLine
param-doc.p: Assume the first line of the dictionary is a header, the feature values will be taken from the header line. Ignored if trieSource is set.

param-doc.name: keyIndex
param-doc.p: Specifies the index of the column that contains the entry key (0 is the first).
